abstract: An action that can end a search interaction.
overview:
## Overview

Use the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/EnvironmentValues/dismissSearch] environment value to get the instance of this structure for a given [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Environment]. Then call the instance to dismiss the current search interaction. You call the instance directly because it defines a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/DismissSearchAction/callAsFunction()] method that Swift calls when you call the instance.

When you dismiss search, SwiftUI:

Use this action to dismiss a search operation based on another user interaction. For example, consider a searchable view with a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Button] that presents more information about the first matching item from a collection:

The button becomes visible only after the user enters search text that produces a match. When the user taps the button, SwiftUI shows a sheet that provides more information about the item, including an Add button for adding the item to a stored list of items:

People can dismiss the sheet by dragging it down, effectively canceling the operation, leaving the in-progress search interaction intact. Alternatively, people can tap the Add button to store the item. Because the person using your app is likely to be done with both the detail view and the search interaction at this point, the button’s closure also uses the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/EnvironmentValues/dismiss] property to dismiss the sheet, and the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/EnvironmentValues/dismissSearch] property to reset the search field.

items.description: Dismisses the current search operation, if any.
items.name: callAsFunction()

items.description: Programmatically detect and dismiss a search field.
items.name: Managing search interface activation

items.description: A Boolean value that indicates when the user is searching.
items.name: isSearching

items.description: An action that ends the current search interaction.
items.name: dismissSearch

items.description: Marks this view as searchable with programmatic presentation of the search field.
items.name: searchable(text:isPresented:placement:prompt:)

items.description: Marks this view as searchable with text and tokens, as well as programmatic presentation.
items.name: searchable(text:tokens:isPresented:placement:prompt:token:)

items.description: Marks this view as searchable, which configures the display of a search field.
items.name: searchable(text:editableTokens:isPresented:placement:prompt:token:)

items.description: Marks this view as searchable with text, tokens, and suggestions, as well as programmatic presentation.
items.name: searchable(text:tokens:suggestedTokens:isPresented:placement:prompt:token:)

title: DismissSearchAction
